info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for performing operations on Backend entity in Azure API Management deployment. The Backend entity in API Management represents a backend service that is configured to skip certification chain validation when using a self-signed certificate to test mutual certificate authentication.

get.description: Lists a collection of backends in the specified service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| title | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| url | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Lists a collection of Backend entities.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the details of the backend specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: backendId
parameters.description: Identifier of the Backend entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The response body contains the specified Backend entity.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: backendId
parameters.description: Identifier of the Backend entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. Not required when creating an entity, but required when updating an entity.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

properties.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Backend operation.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

200.description: The existing backend was successfully updated.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: backendId
parameters.description: Identifier of the Backend entity. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.

200.description: Specified backend entity exists and current entity state version is present in the ETag header.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

post.description: Notifies the APIM proxy to create a new connection to the backend after the specified timeout. If no timeout was specified, timeout of 2 minutes is used.

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

after.description: Duration in ISO8601 format after which reconnect will be initiated. Minimum duration of the Reconnect is PT2M.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.
